abstract.p: Suze DiPietro's An Angel Knocks on Hell's Door is one of first books being published through Xlibris, online book store (S)

block.p: Is revealing a father's affair to the rest of the family an obligation or a betrayal, especially if the father leaves and the family is plunged into poverty in a gritty neighborhood riddled with problems?

That is one of the questions explored in ''An Angel Knocks on Hell's Door,'' a 260-page work of fiction by Suze DiPietro that is among the first books being published through an online book store that creates the book and mails it to the consumer. In the near future, Xlibris, the electronic publisher, wants to also make the books available for reading online, said Roland LaPlante, chief marketing officer for Xlibris.

That is one of the questions explored in ''An Angel Knocks on Hell's Door,'' a 260-page work of fiction by Suze DiPietro that is among the first books being published through an online book store that creates the book and mails it to the consumer. In the near future, Xlibris, the electronic publisher, wants to also make the books available for reading online, said Roland LaPlante, chief marketing officer for Xlibris.

The book, the second work of fiction by Ms. DiPietro, who is public relations director for Trump Taj Mahal and Trump Marina in Atlantic City and lives in Petersburg, tells the story of a 16-year-old girl forced to grow up among drugs and gangs after her father deserts the family. Once a consumer orders this or any other book at www.xlibris.com, it is printed , bound and shipped. The Xlibris books also are sold through other online bookstores.
Ms. DiPietro will be signing copies of her book at Borders Books in the Hamilton Mall, Atlantic City, on Thursday and at Atlantic Books, Ocean One Mall, Atlantic City, on Sept. 16, 2 to 4 p.m.
